clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of HuCNS-SC in Subjects With Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib Study of the Safety and Preliminary Efficacy of Allogeneic Intracerebral Human Central Nervous System Stem Cell Transplantation in Subjects With Non-Refractory Infantile and Late Infantile Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinosis

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this Phase Ib study is to determine if "Human Central Nervous System Stem Cells"(HuCNS-SC) is safe to be transplanted in subjects with infantile and late infantile neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis. The study will also measure post-transplantation disease progression.

detailed_description.textblock: Participation in this study will involve screening assessments, surgery to implant HuCNS-SC, medication to suppress immune system and a series of follow-up assessments.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Safety assessment through clinical, neurological and MRI evaluation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in neurological, neuropsychological development, MRI and MRS

intervention.description: Surgery to implant human CNS stem cells

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 6 months to 6 years
- Male or female
- Clinical diagnosis of Infantile neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis or late infantile neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis
- CLN1 or CLN2 mutation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previously received an organ, tissue or bone marrow transplantation
- Previously participated in any gene or cell therapy study
- Infection with hepatitis virus, cytomegalovirus, Epstein-Barr virus, or Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV)
- Current or prior cancer
- Bleeding disorder
- Unable to have an MRI scan
